title: BS Electronics Engineering – Student Outcomes
student_outcome_1: Apply knowledge of mathematics, natural science, and engineering fundamentals to solve complex engineering problems.
student_outcome_2: Conduct investigations of complex problems using research-based knowledge and research methods including design of experiments, analysis and interpretation of data, and synthesis of information to provide valid conclusions.
student_outcome_3: Design solutions for complex engineering problems and design systems, components, or processes that meet specified needs with appropriate consideration for public health and safety, cultural, societal, and environmental considerations.
student_outcome_4: Function effectively as an individual, and as a member or leader in diverse teams and in multidisciplinary settings.
student_outcome_5: Identify, formulate, research literature, and analyze complex engineering problems reaching substantiated conclusions using first principles of mathematics, natural sciences and engineering sciences.
student_outcome_6: Apply ethical principles and commit to professional ethics and responsibilities and norms of engineering practice.
student_outcome_7: Communicate effectively on complex engineering activities with the engineering community and with society at large, such as being able to comprehend and write effective reports and design documentation, make effective presentations, and give and receive clear instructions.
student_outcome_8: Understand and evaluate the sustainability and impact of professional engineering work in the solution of complex engineering problems in societal and environmental contexts.
student_outcome_9: Recognize the need for, and have the preparation and ability to engage in independent and life-long learning in the broadest context of technological change.
student_outcome_10: Apply reasoning informed by contextual knowledge to assess societal, health, safety, legal and cultural issues and the consequent responsibilities relevant to professional engineering practice.
student_outcome_11: Create, select and apply appropriate techniques, resources, and modern engineering and IT tools, including prediction and modeling, to complex engineering activities, with an understanding of the limitations.
student_outcome_12: Apply engineering and management principles as a member and leader in a team, to manage projects and in multidisciplinary environments.
student_outcome_13: Apply knowledge of electronic engineering in the design and development of electronic systems.
student_outcome_14: Practice Christian values in one’s personal and professional life in the service of the CICM mission.
